page.title: 06Village Houses
page.content:
The village of Upper Heyford is T-shaped with the main north-south road following the short arm of the T.Along this road are situated about a dozen semi-detached council houses.
The long arm of the T runs downhill from the main road with several old stone houses at the top of the hill. Mid way down the hill are an old granary and victorian school house which have been converted to private dwellings.Also four old stone terraced houses.Some of the houses have thatched roofs.
At the bottom of the hill are four more council houses and three large detached houses which flank the canal. Three new houses are being built in a cul de sac to the right of this hill.
